intro: Fagara culantrilo var. insularis, commonly known as the island soursop, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into round, spiny fruits resembling a soursop. The fruit contains a single large, elongated seed and is typically harvested when fully mature. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
